fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

List of duplicate and invalid e-mail addresses during Jira Import is not complete

h3. Environment

* Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Import backup file that contains duplicate or invalid e-mails being used for multiple user accounts

h3. Expected Results

Customer is presented with full list of all duplicate or invalid e-mails in the backup to update

h3. Actual Results

Only some of the duplicate or invalid e-mails are listed. After updating all e-mails in the list that shows and proceeding with the import, the import fails with error:

{quote}
Cannot start import - multiple users have the same email address: <emailAddress>
{quote}

h3. Notes

The e-mail address listed in the error never showed up in the list of duplicate or ivnalid e-mails to update when running the Jira import. If you check the entities.xml file, you will confirm that there are duplicate e-mails linked to multiple user accounts.

h3. Workaround

Ensure all user accounts have unique e-mail addresses on the Source Jira instance before exporting a site backup to import in to Cloud
fields.summary: List of duplicate and invalid e-mail addresses during Jira Import is not complete

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the CSV export gives the issue Sprint by name. This is useful for reporting when users need to identify the sprints. However, to import sprint details using CSV, JIRA requires the Sprint ID instead as this uniquely identifies the Sprint in the instance. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Add another column along with the Sprint Name for Sprint ID so that it this CSV is used for import, then this can be easily mapped.
fields.summary: CSV Export should add Sprint ID column to ease importing back into Jira

fields.description:
h3. Summary
post-function to copy the description to a custom field inserts the word "Optional"
h3. Environment
Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a custom field of type Text, multi-line. Let's say _Description2_
# In a workflow transition, create a post-function to copy the description of the issue to the custom field
# Execute the transition and notice that the field _Description2_ gets populated with the text from the description, but the word *Optional[* will be appended:
 !_TST-3__test_copy_description_-_Jira.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
The description would be copied to the custom field.

h3. Actual Results
The description is copied, but *Optional[]* is appended.
 
h3. Notes
I tried changing the configuration of the field _Description2_ to *required*, expecting that the post-function would append *required[]*, but that was not the case, the _description2_ was still *optional[]*.

h3. Workaround

An Automation Rule to copy the rule won't append the Optional information.
fields.summary: post-function to copy the description to a custom field inserts the word "Optional"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When creating JQL Filters that use a long and extensive query, for example "status in()", but with more than 50 statuses, it will break, returning the error:
{code}
Error occurred communicating with the server. Please reload the page and try again.
{code}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Use the Advanced Search to search for issues using JQL
# Create a query using function as "status in()", "project in()" and add more than 50 options

h3. Expected Results
It should return the issues, even though it could take a while.

h3. Actual Results
It throws an error, that doesn't give much explanation or clarification about it.

h3. Workaround
The workaround would be to use the REST API to retrieve the values.
https://developer.atlassian.com/server/jira/platform/jira-rest-api-examples/#searching-for-issues-examples
fields.summary: Long JQL Queries Break the Search Returning Errors

fields.description:

fields.summary: Ability to restrict access per component

fields.description:
*Problem Definition*
When using the Message Custom Field (for edit), on multiple issue types and such field is selected, somehow there's a swap that occurs during the change, when you switch between Issue types. which causes preferences not to be saved.

{panel:title=Reproducing the Problem|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ff7f7f|titleBGColor=#ff7f7f|bgColor=#e5e5e5}
 # Create two custom field using the field type "Message Custom Field (for edit)"
 # Create Issue type screen scheme and associate one of the field per Issue type e.g. Bug and Task Issue type
 # Add those fields to the screen of each Issue type.
 # Try to "Create" an Issue
 # If it's on Bug Issue Type that has the field e.g. "IT Global: Bug Template" selected and shown on screen
 # Swap Issue type to *Task Issue type*, Click on *Configure Fields* and tick the field e.g."IT Global: Task Template"
 # Notice that the Task Issuetype will now have the "IT Global: Task Template" field and the Bug Issue Type field "IT Global: Bug Template" will be lost in the configuration because another value was ticked on the modal screen.{panel}

*Expected Behaviour*
* If one Issue Type that holds the Message Custom Field (for edit) is ticked and another Issue type of a different custom field but the same field type is ticked, Jira is suppose to save that preference.

*Actual Behaviour*
* Ticking the custom field of Message Custom Field (for edit), deselects the other Message Custom Field (for edit) for every other Issue type. Below video shows the behaviour
 [^Message Custom (for edit).mov] 

*Workaround*
* None at the moment.
fields.summary: Message Custom Field (for edit) display becomes unticked on the Configure Fields list when used by other Issue types

fields.description:
h3. *Problem Definition*

Currently, when using Trello and the Jira "Powerup Add-on" to create issues from Trello, you are only able to see Projects that you have recently accessed.
h3. *Suggested Solution*

Provide the ability to search for projects rather that having only the project that was accessed by the user.
h3. *Why this is important*

Using multiple Atlassian Product to serve their needs. However, It makes the Integration daunting and a bit redundant, as users might as well just create issues from Jira Cloud.
h3. *Workaround*

You will need to visit the project on Jira first, before the specific project you're looking for can be viewed from within Trello.
fields.summary: Provide a Search Input when Creating Jira Issues from Trello
Design Guideline sites point to developer.atlassian.com, rather than atlassian.design

fields.description:
h3. Summary

It is possible to assign issues for Service Desk portal-only customers if you use the post function "assign issues for the reporter". 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add the post function 'assign issues for the reporter' when the reporter is an SD customer
# Perform the transition

h3. Expected Results

The post function don't assign the issue for the reporter if it is a Service Desk portal-only user

h3. Actual Results

The issue is assigned for the reporter even without permission or application license to do so. 
 
h3. Notes

The problem seems to happen even without customisations on the Permission scheme. So, it doesn't look like a regression of [JRACLOUD-63127|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-63127].

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The Logged time doesn't follow the *Time display format* in the new issue view.
h3. Environment

Jira Cloud with the new issue view.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Enable the new issue view on the *Profile Settings*.
 # Add *Time Tracking* at *Jira settings* > *Issues* > *Time tracking*.
 # Add the following configuration to *Working hours per day*; *Working days per week*; *Time display format*; *Default unit for time tracking*:
 !Screen Shot 2019-03-18 at 14.20.29.png|thumbnail!
 # Open the issue and enter a value greater than 4h ( 8h as an example ) on *Log work*.

h3. Expected Results

*Time tracking* on the issue view returns 8h logged.

!Screen Shot 2019-03-18 at 14.19.39.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

*Time tracking* on the issue view returns 2w logged.

!Screen Shot 2019-03-18 at 14.19.11.png|thumbnail!

Note: this happens to any option added to *Time display format*.
h3. Workaround

This specifically happens on the new issue view only. You can either permanently disable the new issue view on your *Personal Settings* or temporarily with the *See the old view* button.
fields.summary: The Logged time doesn't follow the Time display format in the new issue view.

fields.description:
h3.Summary

Side bar short cut that links to the JQL issue navigator page caches JQL filter selection.

h3.Steps to Replicate.

When selecting a JQL custom filter, the URL on the browser will change to <atlassian-domain>.atlassian.net/issues/?filter=XXXX (where XXXX is the filter ID). 

When this happens and you attempt to navigate back to the issue navigator page via the side bar, you will be redirected back to the same filter.

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

This behavior is confusing as it creates a loop that prevents the user from starting a fresh JQL search. It seems that once a JQL filter is selected, access to <atlassian-domain>.atlassian.net/issues will always bring you back to the selected filter. 

h3.Expected Behavior

<atlassian-domain>.atlassian.net/issues  should not cache filter selection and should always bring user back to fresh search.

h3.Current Behavior

<atlassian-domain>.atlassian.net/issues  always loop user back to the selected filter. User is not able to start a new JQL search due to this.

h3.Workaround

User the 'Search Issues' link instead of the 'Advanced search for issues' link to start a new JQL search.

 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: <atlassian-domain>.atlassian.net/issues caches JQL filter selection

Jira Cloud

 # Got to Jira Settings->Apps->Manage Apps
 # Click on the "Build a new app" option.

h3. Expected Results

The user gets redirected to the respective page where he can build or have more information to create a new Jira app.
h3. Actual Results 

It gets redirected to a dead link.
{noformat}
https://<domain>.atlassian.net/plugins/servlet/$uriBuilder.buildUpmDacLandingPageUri({noformat}

h3. Workaround
Customers can visit the page linked from "build a new app" directly by pasting this URL in the browser:

<site-name>/plugins/servlet/upm/develop?source=manage{noformat}
fields.summary: "Build a new app" option under manage apps gives a 404 error

fields.description:
Why does it take 4 steps to move an item from one project to another in Jira? 

We triage in one project and assign across teams. The same experience happens for one or twenty issues when using that issue's ellipsis menu to move the issue to another board. Most times I need to select an issue type because it doesn't know that 'bug' = 'bug'. Every time takes over 4 steps.

Suggestion: Just let me confirm the change and modify a type/status in one page before submitted.
fields.summary: Moving Jira issue between projects takes too many clicks

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

h3. Environment
Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a screen for creating sub-tasks that includes a required field
# Ensure that the project has multiple sub-task types that all use that screen for creating an issue
# Start creating a new sub-task in the parent issue and select a sub-task type other than the default.
# click create, the create sub-task screen should be shown

h3. Expected Results

The Selected sub-task type from the parent issue would be carried over to the create issue screen.

h3. Actual Results

The selected sub-task type is re-set to whatever the default is in the create issue screen and is not carried over.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no workaround. If you encounter this issue, don't bother setting the type for projects that you know are impacted. Alternatively you can change the required fields to no longer be required or remove the required fields from the create issue screen for the sub-tasks to prevent the create sub-task screen from blocking the sub task creation.
fields.summary: Creating Sub-Tasks where create Sub-task screen is required does not preserve selected sub-task type

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The "People" section of the projects will not load when there are too many users listed


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a project and navigate to "People"
# Add 5k+ more users to a role. 

h3. Expected Results
The page successfully loads

h3. Actual Results

The page won't load and the following error is displayed:

_Something's gone wrong. A problem prevented the page from loading. Refresh and try again._

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

 
h3. Notes
Cloud instances have a limit of 5k users, however, it is still possible to add *Service Desk portal-only* accounts to project roles.

Contact the Atlassian Support to evaluate if there's a workaround to your instance.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When you search for a filter in the quick search, and click on the result, it will not redirect you to that filter.

It does not happen if you select a recent filter though.

See the recording:  [^Selecting filter - quick search.mp4] 

If you select it from a different section, it will redirect you to the previous filter/search you've made (be it a filter, or a manual advanced search):
 !Screen Shot 2019-03-14 at 10.43.18.png|thumbnail! 

Basically, Jira will redirect you to the most recent search instead of the filter you've selected.

h3. Environment

JIRA Cloud.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Click on the magnifying glass icon in the side bar -> search for a filter -> click on it:
 !Screen Shot 2019-03-14 at 10.44.53.png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2019-03-14 at 10.45.08.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Expected Results

You will be redirected to the filter search according to your selection.

h3. Actual Results

You are redirected to the most recent search/filter you have accessed.

h3. Workaround

It works if you select the filter from:
* Recent filters in the quick search;
* Issues and Filters:
** Starred filters;
** View all filters -> search for the desire filter.
fields.summary: Selecting a filter when searching for it in the quick search will not redirect you to the selected filter

fields.description:
h2. Summary

JSD customer / agents + Jira users cannot be created with error "all directory read only", when created from in-product invite + REST APIs. Problem was first observed in JSD Widget and public REST API, but later discovered to affect other parts of JSD / Jira:
• JSD anonymous portal ticket creation (if email address is a customer account that doesn’t exist and needs user creation)
• JSD email ticket creation (if email address is a customer account that doesn’t exist and needs user creation)
• JSD widget ticket creation (if email address is a customer account that doesn’t exist and needs user creation)
• JSD customer portal signup (customer account creation)
• JSD invite customer (customer account creation)
• JSD invite agent
• JSD public api for creating customer accounts
• Jira REST API user creation

Status Page: https://status.atlassian.com/incidents/9r351r9v5cdw
fields.summary: JSD agents / JSD customer accounts / Jira users cannot be created: all directory read only (from in-product invite / REST api)

fields.description:
h1. As a Jira user I would like to have an easy way to *split an already created Issue* when the workload of this Ticket seems to high to do it in one go. 

 

*Feature:* While viewing my already created an formulated issue (maybe even with an estimation of the workload set) a buttonclick should split this issue into two identical ones. Maybe directly opening a window in which I can formulate the differences between these two issues on basis of the already saved information for the old issue.

 

(on) Issue-Split would be the same as duplicating an existing issue and working out the differences between these two issues. As this is an often used case in out daily work I would appreciate this feature.
fields.summary: FeatureRequest: 1-Click Issue Split

fields.description:
h3. Summary
* When exporting a list of users from User Management > Users > Export users and then filtering by group via the "Only these groups" option - the search doesn't work for groups that aren't appearing in the drop-down
* Only 18 groups are shown in the drop-down menu

h3. Environment
* Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to User Management > Users > Export users
# Try to filter the export by the "Only these groups"
# Search for a group that isn't appearing in the drop-down options listed

h3. Expected Results
* All groups visible in the drop-down menu
* All groups searchable when typing the group name

h3. Actual Results
* Groups that are not appearing in the list(only 18 groups listed even though there are many more on the instance) are searchable
* Only 18 groups visible in the drop-down menu

h3.Workaround
Edit/resend the call or copy an example call as cURL:

* Open the browser web console > Network(tab)
* Download a CSV as normal
* Locate the request, should be something like this: POST https://<host>.atlassian.net/gateway/api/adminhub/um/site/<org_id>/users/export
* Edit/resend(Firefox) or copy as cURL(Chrome)
* Just in case it's useful https://stackoverflow.com/questions/28775123/edit-and-replay-xhr-chrome-firefox-etc/28775346
* If using Chrome paste command into Terminal/CMD and run. Example call:
{noformat}
curl 'https://<host>.atlassian.net/gateway/api/adminhub/um/site/<org_id>/users/export' -H 'pragma: no-cache' -H 'cookie: <example_string>; cloud.session.token=<token>' -H 'origin: https://<host>.atlassian.net' -H 'accept-encoding: gzip, deflate, br' -H 'accept-language: en' -H 'user-agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10_13_6) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/71.0.3578.98 Safari/537.36' -H 'content-type: application/json' -H 'accept: */*' -H 'cache-control: no-cache' -H 'authority: <host>.atlassian.net' -H 'referer: https://<host>.atlassian.net/admin/s/<org_id>/users' --data-binary '{"includeApplicationAccess":false,"includeGroups":false,"includeInactiveUsers":false,"selectedGroupIds":["group1_id","group2_id"]}' --compressed > example.csv
{noformat}
* Exported groups are defined using the "External Group ID":
"selectedGroupIds":["123456aaaa-a123-1234-aaaa-aaaaaaaaaaa","123456aaaa-a123-1234-aaaa-bbbbbbbb"]
* The group ID can be found in the URL of the group details page(User Management > Groups > [Group_name])
fields.summary: User Export not showing all groups and groups that aren't appearing are not searchable

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Jira is sending duplicate notifications of the same events. 
This bug causes duplicates where emails are absolutely identical. Duplicates are sent 1-2 minutes apart.

h3. Expected Results
Email notification is sent only once.

h3. Actual Results
Duplicate notifications are sent for the same event. You can see absolutely the same email sent several times.
 
h3. Notes
N/A

h3.Workaround
There is no workaround at the moment as it happens due to timeouts internally.
You can get in touch with [Support|https://support.atlassian.com/contact/] to have your issue checked and verified.
fields.summary: Duplicate email notifications being sent for same events

fields.description:
h3. Problem

When a site-administrator invites a new user and receives the error message:

(warning) Something went wrong. We couldn't send your invitation. Try inviting that user again.

To replicate :
 # Log in to User Management as site-admin
 # Click on invite user
 # Add the new user email address in email addresses field
 # Check on JIRA software Application access
 # Proceed to click on "invite user":
 Refer to screenshot below:
 !Screen+Shot+2019-01-29+at+11.57.06+AM.png|thumbnail! 

 # You will see the error message below at the bottom left of the screen:

 !Screen+Shot+2019-01-29+at+11.52.47+AM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Resolution

It is best to check Product Access, for example for JIRA Software, see if the license usage has reached its maximum limit.

If yes, you can do one of the following to address this issue:
 Option 1: Increase the license limit for JIRA software.
 Option 2: Uncheck the JIRA software application access checkbox when inviting a user (in this case all newly invited users are not be able to use JIRA software features after invitation).
fields.summary: Improve messaging when inviting users fails due to insufficient licenses

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Unable to import more than 1000 issues via CSV. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Export more than 1000 of issues from your Cloud instance using CSV exporter
# Import them to your Cloud instance via CSV

h3. Expected Results
Able to import without hitting any performance issue

h3. Actual Results
Error stating that token is missing
{quote}
Jira could not complete this action due to a missing form token.

You may have cleared your browser cookies, which could have resulted in the expiry of your current form token. A new form token has been reissued.

Request URL: /secure/admin/CsvValueMappingsPage.jspa

The original input has been captured and you can retry the operation.

Sorry, but any file attachments in the original input will be lost.
{quote}

h3.Workaround
Split the CSV file to lower the number of issues to be imported, less than 1000 issues per file

# Create a Jira Server instance

h3. Expected results

fields.description:
h3.Summary
When performing an import in Jira Server, the import will fail due to certain fields using the incorrect data

h3.Environment
* Jira Server 8.0.2
* Postgres 9.6

h3.Steps to Reproduce
# Generate backup from cloud instance
# Restore to JIRA Server 8.0.2

h3.Expected Results
The import completes successfully

h3.Actual Results
The import fails, with the following message in the UI:
{quote}
Error importing data: java.lang.NumberFormatException: For input string: "2018-05-21 05:52:10.449712"
{quote}

The following stack trace can be found in {{atlassian-jira.log}}:
{noformat}
2019-03-13 16:40:43,078 JiraImportTaskExecutionThread-1 ERROR admin 1000x275x1 12q1ai3 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/SetupImport.jspa [c.a.j.bc.dataimport.OfbizImportHandler] Failed to set attribute 'CustomFieldValue.updated' with value '2018-05-21 05:52:10.449712'. Error: For input string: "2018-05-21 05:52:10.449712"
2019-03-13 16:40:43,078 JiraImportTaskExecutionThread-1 ERROR admin 1000x275x1 12q1ai3 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/SetupImport.jspa [c.a.j.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService] Error importing data: java.lang.NumberFormatException: For input string: "2018-05-21 05:52:10.449712"
java.lang.NumberFormatException: For input string: "2018-05-21 05:52:10.449712"
	at java.lang.NumberFormatException.forInputString(NumberFormatException.java:65)
	at java.lang.Long.parseLong(Long.java:589)
	at java.lang.Long.valueOf(Long.java:803)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericEntity.setString(GenericEntity.java:391)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.OfbizImportHandler.parseValue(OfbizImportHandler.java:306)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.OfbizImportHandler.startElement(OfbizImportHandler.java:206)
	at org.apache.xerces.parsers.AbstractSAXParser.startElement(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.parsers.AbstractXMLDocumentParser.emptyElement(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.impl.XMLDocumentFragmentScannerImpl.scanStartElement(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.impl.XMLDocumentFragmentScannerImpl$FragmentContentDispatcher.dispatch(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.impl.XMLDocumentFragmentScannerImpl.scanDocument(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.parsers.XML11Configuration.parse(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.parsers.XML11Configuration.parse(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.parsers.XMLParser.parse(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.parsers.AbstractSAXParser.parse(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.jaxp.SAXParserImpl$JAXPSAXParser.parse(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.security.xml.RestrictedXMLReader.parse(RestrictedXMLReader.java:103)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService.restoreData(DefaultDataImportService.java:897)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService.performImport(DefaultDataImportService.java:740)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService.doImport(DefaultDataImportService.java:324)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.setup.DataImportAsyncCommand.unsafeCall(DataImportAsyncCommand.java:82)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.setup.DataImportAsyncCommand.call(DataImportAsyncCommand.java:64)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.setup.DataImportAsyncCommand.call(DataImportAsyncCommand.java:30)
	at com.atlassian.jira.task.ImportTaskManagerImpl$TaskCallableDecorator.call(ImportTaskManagerImpl.java:176)
	at com.atlassian.jira.task.ImportTaskManagerImpl$TaskCallableDecorator.call(ImportTaskManagerImpl.java:148)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
	at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:511)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1149)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:624)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748)
{noformat}

h3.Investigation
Looking at {{entities.xml}}, we can see the CustomFieldValue mentioned:

{code}
<CustomFieldValue id="10000" issue="10004" customfield="10013" textvalue="10000_*:*_1_*:*_4474_*|*_10001_*:*_1_*:*_0" created="2018-05-21 05:52:10.449712" updated="2018-05-21 05:52:10.449712"/>
{code}

In a Jira Server Instance, the {{created}} column does not exist, and the {{updated}} column is a unix epoch (and this is reflected in the database)

{code}
<CustomFieldValue id="10000" issue="10000" customfield="10106" updated="1550556055895" numbervalue="2.0"/>
{code}

h3.Workaround
No workaround is available at this time.
fields.summary: Cloud to Server Import Fails due to some columns using the incorrect format

fields.description:

When performing an import in Jira Server, the import will fail. The behaviour seen here is similar to JRACLOUD-63367; however there is an expanded list of tables.

h3.Environment

h3.Steps to Reproduce
# Generate backup from cloud instance

	at org.apache.xerces.parsers.AbstractXMLDocumentParser.emptyElement(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.impl.XMLDocumentFragmentScannerImpl.scanStartElement(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.impl.XMLDocumentFragmentScannerImpl$FragmentContentDispatcher.dispatch(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.impl.XMLDocumentFragmentScannerImpl.scanDocument(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.parsers.XML11Configuration.parse(Unknown Source)

	at org.apache.xerces.parsers.XMLParser.parse(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.parsers.AbstractSAXParser.parse(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.xerces.jaxp.SAXParserImpl$JAXPSAXParser.parse(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.security.xml.RestrictedXMLReader.parse(RestrictedXMLReader.java:103)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService.parseXmlAndValidateBackupData(DefaultDataImportService.java:390)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService.doImport(DefaultDataImportService.java:290)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.setup.DataImportAsyncCommand.unsafeCall(DataImportAsyncCommand.java:82)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.setup.DataImportAsyncCommand.call(DataImportAsyncCommand.java:64)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.setup.DataImportAsyncCommand.call(DataImportAsyncCommand.java:30)
	at com.atlassian.jira.task.ImportTaskManagerImpl$TaskCallableDecorator.call(ImportTaskManagerImpl.java:176)
	at com.atlassian.jira.task.ImportTaskManagerImpl$TaskCallableDecorator.call(ImportTaskManagerImpl.java:148)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
	at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:511)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1149)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:624)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748)
{noformat}

This error can be observed for the following entities:
* UpgradeTaskHistoryAuditLog
* UpgradeTaskHistory
* FieldScope
* FixVersion
* GlobalCustomFieldProjectAssociation
* HierarchyLevel
* IssueComponent
* IssueList
* IssueListEntry
* IssueParentAssociation
* IssueTypeFieldAssociation
* IssueTypeHierarchyAssociation
* ModuleStatus
* ProjectConfiguration
* Severity
* UsernameHistory
* AdHocUpgradeTaskHistory
* AffectsVersion
* AttachmentPanel
* BaseHierarchyLevel

h3.Workaround
# Extract the backup - you'll have {{activeobjects.xml}}, {{entities.xml}} and {{data}} in the current folder
# Execute the following commands:
{code}
egrep -v "(UpgradeTaskHistoryAuditLog|UpgradeTaskHistory|FieldScope|FixVersion|GlobalCustomFieldProjectAssociation|HierarchyLevel|IssueComponent|IssueList|IssueListEntry|IssueParentAssociation|IssueTypeFieldAssociation|IssueTypeHierarchyAssociation|ModuleStatus|ProjectConfiguration|Severity|UsernameHistory|AdHocUpgradeTaskHistory|AffectsVersion|AttachmentPanel|BaseHierarchyLevel)" entities.xml > entities-purged.xml

mv entities-purged.xml entities.xml ; zip -r FixedBackup.zip entities.xml activeobjects.xml data
{code}
fields.summary: Importing from Jira Cloud to Server fails due to unknown entities

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When using {{/rest/api/3/groups/picker}} it would be great if queries are treated case insensitive

h3. Background

Vendor raised feature request in DEVHELP with the following use case and notes:
{quote}
"query~admin" or "query~Admin" doesn't work at all. It is just ignored.

I discovered another thing, though. I have a group "site-admins". 
When I search with rest/api/3/groups/picker?query=Site-Admins it returns this group.
When I search with rest/api/3/groups/picker?query=site-admins it returns this group. 
When I search with rest/api/3/groups/picker?query=site-adm it returns this group. 
When I search with rest/api/3/groups/picker?query=Site-Adm it returns nothing. 
So the search seems to be case insensitive only when I provide the full name of a group.

A use case:
We have a filter option in our apps to search groups. When searching for a group in the input, the search is case sensitive. So if a user has a group named: "Developers", he can't find them by inserting e.g. "deve".
{quote}
fields.summary: Make group picker case insensitive for /rest/api/3/groups/picker

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Import to Jira Cloud is failing due to Duplicated users even though there aren't duplicated users in the source instance.

h3. Environment
Cloud -> Cloud
Server -> Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Generate a backup from a Jira instance(Cloud or Server)
# Import this backup to another Jira Cloud instance.

h3. Expected Results
The import will complete successfully.

h3. Actual Results
The import fails at 90% where in the logs it says that there are duplicated users.
{code}
Caused by: com.atlassian.crowd.exception.runtime.OperationFailedException: com.atlassian.idp.client.exceptions.UserAlreadyExistsException: {"schemas":["urn:ietf:params:scim:api:messages:2.0:Error"],"status":"409","scimType":"uniqueness","detail":"Duplicate email address: user_email_address@email.com","errorType":"UserAlreadyExists","message":"Duplicate email address: user_email_address@email.com","data":"user_email_address@email.com"}
{code} 

h3. Workaround
A. Removing all the users from the backup file allow the import to go through.
B. Removing all the users from the target instance also allow the import to go through. For that, reach out to Atlassian Support for assistance.
fields.summary: Import from another Jira instance fails with duplicated user error.

fields.description:
{panel}
h3. Summary

Accessing an issue, in the same tab, from a filter that shows the issues in the List View mode, shows the old issue view.

h3. Environment

JIRA Cloud.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Search with a filter
 # Change the results to appear in the _List View_ mode
 # Open the issue in the same tab
 *You will see the old issue view*
 # Open the issue in a new tab
 *You will see the new issue view*

h3. Expected Results

Always shows the new issue view.
h3. Actual Results

Opening the issue in the same tab will show the old issue view.

h3. Workaround

Open the issue in a new tab.




It is important to note that, when you open the issue in a new tab you will get the following URL:

* https://instance.atlassian.net/browse/issuekey

However, if you open in the same tab (when you get the old issue view), you will get the following URL:

* https://instance.atlassian.net/browse/issuekey?filter=10109

 
{panel}
fields.summary: Accessing issue in the same tab from a filter in the List View mode shows old issue view

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At this moment, when searching for issues in Jira, it is not possible to search for Epics and their respective children, while also applying issue linking hierarchy on the search, as this example:

EPIC 1
Story 
Sub-Task
Sub-Task
Sub-Task
Story
Bug
Task
Story
Sub-Task
Sub-Task
EPIC 2
Story
Sub-Task
Sub-Task
Bug
Story
Story
Bug
Etc.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add the ability to search for Epics and their respective children, while also applying issue linking hierarchy when searching for issues.

h3. Why this is important
This should enhance Jira's searching capabilities.

h3. Workaround 
While not exactly the same, admins can create a *Scrum board* where the team will have a global view on all Epics, children and their respective sub-tasks.

 !Epic issue sub.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to sort issues by Epic and its children when searching for issues

fields.description:
Pasting images in Jira uploads the image to the issue and inserts a thumbnail into the editor. Pasting text inserts the copied text into the editor.

Pasting a mixed-media copy (text in addition to an image, graphic, or screenshot) results in only the text being inserted to the editor. At best, a placeholder filename is inserted for the image. In most circumstances, the image is simply dropped.

!image-2019-03-11-07-42-26-576.png|width=478,height=238!

Some users would like to select a passage of text with inline images and have the entire body plus the images paste into the editor.

 

*Workaround*: paste the passage, then copy/paste the images separately and individually
fields.summary: Allow mixed-media pastes (text + images) from clipboard in comments

At present, as per [this article|https://confluence.atlassian.com/get-started-with-jira-core/add-users-to-your-project-917965377.html], we can only add existing users and groups to roles in Jira projects.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Jira creates tokens when searching for text fields. 

h3. Environment
 - JIRA Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create New project
 # Create test tickets
 ** *Description*: Assign account departmental
 # Go to issue navigator: https://<EXAMPLE>.atlassian.net/issues/?jql=
 # Conduct the following test using Advance JQL

||JQL||Result||
|text ~ "departmental"|(/)|
|text ~ "assign"|(/)|
|text ~ "account"|(/)|
|text ~ "department"|(x)|

(x) = Issue not found
 (/) = Issue found
h3. Expected Results
 * Find issues with description matching the JQL

h3. Actual Results
 * Exemplified above.

h3. Notes
 * Although the token 'department' is created in the database, the search does not find the issue by that word.

h3. Workaround
 - None
fields.summary: JQL search does not find word that is tokenized

fields.description:
h3. Problem

In the workflow of our issues, we are allowed to create a Scrum board for a specific project. And from there, we may plan a Sprint and include some of the issues into the list. Hence, while some of the issues are inside the Sprint, some may be left out as a Backlog. However at the moment, there's no Condition to restrict the execution of a workflow transition if an issue is not part of an active Sprint.

h3. Suggestion
It will be great if we can add a workflow condition to check if an issue is part of a Sprint, and restrict the execution of a workflow transition if the issue is not part of a Sprint.

h3. workaround
None
fields.summary: Validate if Issue is part of a Sprint in a Workflow

fields.description:
In the filter subscription screen, we can see the column _last sent_ as the last time the filter ran since it runs although no email might be sent. This could cause confusing leading to believe that an email was sent send every time the filter subscription ran.

To avoid this, it would be useful to change this column name to _last run_ instead of _last sent_.
fields.summary: Change Last sent on filter subscrition to last run

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In instances where a project name is big/complex enough, when searching for issues that are in this project, Jira won't load the issue details.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have a project name like Texttexttext-texttext/texttexttexttexttexttext
# Click the magnifying glass on your left sidebar, then click "View all issues" or "advanced search for issues";
# Make sure you have selected the *Detail View* on your right corner when searching for issues;
# Select an issue from the relevant project with big/complex name.

h3. Expected Results
Jira load the issue details as usual.

h3. Actual Results
Issues details are not shown.
 !Screen Shot 2019-03-07 at 18.17.06.png|thumbnail! 

Inspecting the page, we can verify many errors like:

*Uncaught (in promise) Invariant Violation: Minified React error #185; visit https://reactjs.org/docs/error-decoder.html?invariant=185 for the full message or use the non-minified dev environment for full errors and additional helpful warnings.*

"Maximum update depth exceeded. This can happen when a component repeatedly calls setState inside componentWillUpdate or componentDidUpdate. React limits the number of nested updates to prevent infinite loops."

 !Screen Shot 2019-03-07 at 17.53.30.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
At this moment, if admins find it feasible, reduce the project name to a shorter string.
fields.summary: Big, complex project names are breaking the issue search

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When creating a ticket and using the format from the Old Issue View -  example h2. {color:#59afe1}Summary{color} - when in the New Issue View, it will add spaces between lines.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a JIRA issue
# Use format from the Old Issue View
# Access the issue using the New Issue View

h3. Expected Results
It should be formatted correctly.

h3. Actual Results
It adds additional spaces between lines.

h3. Workaround
The workaround would be:
* Disable the New Issue View
* Modify the text to use the format from the new editor.
fields.summary: Creating Issue Using Old Issue View Format Breaks in the New Issue View

fields.description:
There could be times where some sensitive data could be inadvertently added to an issue in a text format, on a comment, description, or other forms (Fields, etc). For security reasons and due to regulations (GDPR and others), this information needs to be removed from the instance. Although the user can remove the text, the information will still be present on the history tab of the issue. 

Since the history tab can't be disabled (JRACLOUD-67300), Would be useful, and at some point necessary, that the administrators have the ability to remove data from the history tab in case they need to hide sensitive information from the instance.
fields.summary: Ability to remove specific information from history Tab

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The jira.clone.prefix can only be set to a text value
h3. Suggested Solution
Allow configuring the jira.clone.prefix to use date and other types of variables
fields.summary: Allow setting the jira.clone.prefix to use date and other types of variables

fields.description:
h3.  
|*Atlassian Update - 20 December 2021*|
|Hi everyone,
Custom field descriptions can now be viewed from within the new issue view. If a custom field has a description, an (i) icon will appear when hovering on the title of the field. For more information on configuring custom fields, view our documentation [here|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-cloud-administration/docs/edit-or-delete-a-custom-field/]. 
 
!Screen Shot 2021-12-20 at 1.09.37 pm.png|width=222,height=130!
 
Thanks
Atlassian Cloud Team
 |
h3. Problem Definition

Customer not able to view custom field description in the new issue view while editing the required fields.
h3. Suggested Solution

Ability to view custom field description in the new issue view while editing the required fields.
h3. Why this is important

Customers would like to see the description of the custom field when editing it to let the concerned user know what value has to be inserted.
fields.summary: Ability to view custom field description in the new issue view

fields.description:
h2. Summary
When searching for Dashboards in Jira, one would need to paste a Dashboard name to look for. One could also paste an Owner name in the search criteria. Considering one has used both, once the search is completed, Dashboard field will keep your search criteria within it while Owner field will be automatically cleared (erased).

h2. Suggestion
To keep the Owner field populated with the latest search criteria as the application does for the Dashboard field.

h2. Current Behaviour
# Access any of the screens in which you can search for dashboards (_/admin/dashboards/ViewSharedDashboards.jspa_ for example) and search for any dashboard/any user - The example below uses Dashboard Alfa and User Alfa:
!Screen Shot 2019-03-06 at 17.43.27.png|thumbnail!
# Click on the Search button.
# Regardless of the search results, one will see the Owner field being erased while the Dashboard field remains untouched:
!Screen Shot 2019-03-06 at 17.43.35.png|thumbnail!

h2. Suggested Behaviour
To keep both fields populated.
fields.summary: Search Shared Dashboards - Remove Auto-Clearing of the Owner Field

fields.description: When I click on an item from a Kanban board, there is a "summary" popup that provides more details about the item. I really wish that you could see & manage watchers from this view. It would be very useful to be able to see who is watching an item without having to drill all the way into the full item.
fields.summary: Manage watchers on the board view

fields.description:
h4. Summary

Jira allows you to use labels with only a white space in it (go to an issue, click on labels, insert a whitespace, create a new label). It also allows you with to *search*  for labels as the following:

{code}labels = ' '{code} (white space between single quotes)

However, if you do perform this search you'll see the following results:

1 - JQL responds with "no results" , and the only error you'll see is QueryComponent!jql.jspa failing with an error 500 in the JS Console:

 !image-2019-03-06-13-55-46-125.png|thumbnail! 

2 - If you save a filter with the above statement it will always throw Null Pointer Exception (error 500)

 !image-2019-03-06-13-52-22-005.png|thumbnail! 

h4. Why is this important

Avoid the silent error and have consistency in the behavior. If having labels as whitespaces does error things out, this should be handled with validation to not allow the usage of that, instead of allowing the usage and breaking filters.

h4. Proposed Solution

Validate label creations and JQL searching to not allow the inclusion of the white spaces
fields.summary: Jira should handle labels with only a single space on it ' '

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Zombie tasks (Task without a parent, and cannot be transitioned ) created during the creation of subtask, when the workflow contains a post function, Copy value from the field in parent task to the subtask.

Please note that the issue is only when the custom field type is Select list (cascading) 
 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Steps to reproduce the issue

* In the Subtask Workflow —> Create issue transition —> Add a post function
* The field (Select list cascade) will take the value from (Select list cascade) Source issue is the parent, destination the sub-task
* Create a Subtask. ( Make sure that the parent task includes the field Select list Cascade)
* During the issue creation, we do observe an error as below.
  !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 
* In spite of the error, an issue is created, which does not have any parent tasks. Also does not have any transition buttons available to it.
* Also this is observed, only when the cascade list option does not have a sub-option. for example in the image below the value PL doesn't have the sub-option. Thus post function fails as it cannot copy a NULL value which None is.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Expected Result
A subtask should be successfully created, with all the transition options.

h3. Workaround

As a workaround, we would suggest you add the values called 'None' or 'NA', so that the field does have some value. And then the post function can copy the same when creating new issues.
fields.summary: Zombie tasks (Task without a parent, and cannot be transitioned ) created during the creation of subtask, when the workflow contains a post function, Copy value from the field in parent task to the subtask.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When impersonating an account using the *Log in as user* button, the Issue search on the navigation bar uses the permissions of the site-admin user instead rather than the user being impersonated.

However, when opening the Issues, it starts taking into account the impersonated account's permission and you're then unable to open the Issue.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have a *Permission Scheme* that only a select set of users have the *Browse Projects* permission (ie: Sam doesn't have access to Project *IDP*)
# Make sure that you have access to this Project (ie: Project *IDP)
# In the *User management*, log in as Sam
# On the Issue search of the navigation bar, do a search using keywords only found in Project *IDP*

h3. Expected Results

You are impersonating Sam's account and Sam does not have access to the *IDP* Project thus you should not get any results related to that Project.

h3. Actual Results

On the navigation bar, you would see Issues from the *IDP* Project, completely ignoring the permissions of the impersonated user. When you try to open the Issues from *IDP*, the permissions then kicks in and you get the error message.

 !2019-03-05_17-25-08.gif|width=400&height=200!
 
h3. Notes

This was tested on Chrome, Safari and Firefox.

h3.Workaround

No known workaround.
fields.summary: The Issue search ignores permissions when impersonating accounts

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When an App is added to Jira it is assigned to all users in the instance License. There's no option for the admins to manage the users that can/can't use the apps installed on the instance. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Add an option for the admins to manage the users that will access the apps installed on the instance

h3. Why this is important
While the app installed follows the license of the instance (number of active license users), it's possible that not all those users will use the app. Therefore, the admins will pay for a license of an app for a tier of users that might be not used by all of them. 

h3. Workaround 
NA
fields.summary: Add option to manage the users that will access apps

fields.description:
Currently there is no way to easily distinguish which project is classic and which is next-gen  by just looking at the list on projects view.

 

The source of this suggestions: [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Next-gen-questions/Easy-way-to-find-all-next-gen-projects/qaq-p/1020486]

 

It would be great to have an additional column to distinguish project generations.
fields.summary: Add an easy way to find all next-gen projects

fields.description:
h3. Summary 
Searching for filters with a - (dash) followed by spaces returns all current filters

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a filter with any JQL
# Save this filter's name as {{test - filter}} - or any other combination containing {{string - string}}
# Go to *View All Filters*
# Search for this filter, writing its name one character at a time

h3. Expected Results
Once you finish typing, the filter matching the name will be the only one being displayed

h3. Actual Results
Once type {{test - }}, it displays +all+ the filters, instead of narrowing down only the ones matching the filter's name.

h3. Workaround
Currently, there are no workarounds available.
fields.summary: Searching for filters with a - (dash) followed by spaces returns all current filters

fields.description:
All validators must pass in order for a transition to complete. Currently an issue will fail as soon as one validator fails, without running subsequent validators. The disadvantage of this is that it staggers the error messages.

For example in my transition I have several validators, in this order:
1. Fields Required (About a dozen fields must be filled out)
2. Date Compare (I want to validate some date fields)
3. Comment Required (Using a custom plugin I ensure a comment is entered)
4. User Picker Validator (Using a custom plugin I ensure a user picker has a minimum number of users selected and that they have been selected from a particular group)

When a user submits a ticket in violation of all four validators they only see the error from 'Fields Required'. When the required field is added and they resubmit they will then see the error from 'Date Compare', and so forth. The overhead of running all validators is low and, while not logically necessary, having the ability to display all error messages simultaneously would enhance usability.
fields.summary: Run all Validators (continue on failure) during workflow transition

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Most site-admins use the *Last seen* attribute present in the user profiles to check which users are actively using the application and maybe deactivate users who have been inactive for too long.

This becomes a problem for users who only create/comment on tickets through emails.
Currently, that date is not updated when users interact with JIRA through email, so the user could have opened an issue today but his *Last seen* date would be set to one month ago as he's not actually accessing the UI to interact with JIRA.

h3. Suggested Solution

Enhance the presence code so it checks for email interactions from the user with JIRA as well.

h3. Workaround 

Suggest your users that are used to working with JIRA through emails only to access it once two weeks so you can continue to check the Last seen date for reference.
fields.summary: Update JIRA Last seen date upon email interaction from the user with JIRA

fields.description:
At the end of a sprint, we click the Complete Sprint button. This lets us choose where to put the unfinished issues, and one of the options in that dialog is "New Sprint".

 

It would be very helpful to us if we could specify the name of this new sprint from this dialog, instead of having Jira name it "\{Name of some other existing sprint} 2".
fields.summary: Allow me to specify the name of a new sprint in Close Sprint Dialog

fields.description:
h3.Summary

As of now, dashboard gadgets only show relative date format which can be pretty ambiguous for users. If possible, do provide an option to change the date format between relative date format or absolute date format.
fields.summary: Configuration to switch between relative or absolute date format for dashboard gadgets

fields.description:
With many issues, an image or graphic communication is extremely useful to accompany the prescribed issue.  Sometimes the image itself does not illustrate specifically the key message of the issue. Whereas a tool to evoke an image editor with functionality to draw/ mark up/ circle/ point with an arrow/ cloud etc would clearly highlight the key focus within the image. 

See an example below.

 

!image-2019-03-02-22-49-06-894.png|width=495,height=227!
fields.summary: Image Editor & copy and paste

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The chart gadget 'Created vs. Resolved' returns 0 issues for the November month  when the timezone of the user is set to Sao Paulo. Apparently, the issue is caused because November is the month that Brazil's enters in DST. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Created vs Resolved chart for the last year (or at least until October of 2018)
# Set your timezone to GMT -03:00 (Sao Paulo)

h3. Expected Results

The gadget returns the correct sum of issues for all months

h3. Actual Results

November of 2018 returns 0 issues.

h3. Workaround

The only available workaround is to change your own timezone.
fields.summary: Gadget 'created vs resolved' returns 0 issues when in specific timezone

fields.description:
h3. Summary

I would like, as a user, to be able to not receive notifications from Jira.

h3. Expected Results

Every user should have the option to receive or not notifications.

h3. Actual Results

There isn't an option for that.
fields.summary: Users have Individual Permission to Disable Notification for Themselves

fields.description:
Changing the name of the Status in any workflow changes the Status in all the linked workflows
Hence, the issues linked to these Workflow automatically move to the new (changed name) status.
A warning to be displayed while changing the name of a Status in any Workflow
This will ensure that the customer is aware of the effects once the name of the Status is changed
fields.summary: A warning to be displayed while changing the name of a Status in any Workflow

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Notification Panel of one user shows issue status in the local language of the other user who performs the action

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set language1 for User1 in their personal settings and language2 for User2 And the default Jira language is set as language 2
# User1 reports an issue and the issue is assigned to User2
# User1 mentions User2 in a comment 
# User2 get notified on the cloud instance and views it by clicking on the Bell Icon available at the bottom left in Jira application or dashboard.

h3. Expected Results
User2 views the notification in language2

h3. Actual Results
User2 gets the actual comment in language2 as expected, however, the status of the issue is in language1
Here is an Example where user Swati with the language set as English is viewing their notification for actions performed by user Shwetha whose language is set as Deutsch.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
Email notifications work fine and contain the correct language for the issue status
fields.summary: Notification Panel of one user shows issue status in the local language of the other user who performs the action

fields.description:
h2. Description

When there are field validators  on the create issue transition for the sub-task's workflow, Jira prompts a screen (for that you be able to edit the validated fields) when creating the sub-task. If you change the name of the "Create" to anything else (only possible on custom workflows). This screen won't appear and the sub-task creation will fail in the validation

h2. Steps to reproduce

# Create a custom workflow
# Edit the create transition name to something else than 'Create'
# Insert validators in the create transition
# Activate this workflow to be used with sub-tasks
# Try creating the sub-task

h2. Expected Behavior

Jira to prompt a screen for that you insert the fields and be able to create the sub-task

h2. Actual Behavior
*Sub-task is not created*

Jira's UI throw a generic error  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
Issue creation endpoint fails with 400 and the developer panel points out for the validation error message defined in Jira  !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Sub-task creation fails if the create transition is renamed and has validators

fields.description:
h3. Description
When adding a code block to a text field using the new editor, Jira will add invalid characters to the string. This happens for certain syntax languages only (or no languages selected)

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Open an issue
# Edit its description
** (!) In order for this bug to be reproducible, you need to be using the *new text editor*
# Add some piece of code containing *]<text>[*
# Copy the code

h3. Expected Results
By *manually typing* ]test[ and running *xxd <filename>* from terminal, we could confirm the text contained only the characters we had typed
 !Screen Shot 2019-02-28 at 6.00.18 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual results
Although visually the text looks correct, by analyzing the bytes we were able to identify that some invalid characters were added. In the example below, we entered the text *]test[* and analyzed the content:
# Type the exact same string in a code block
 !Screen Shot 2019-02-28 at 6.00.53 PM.png|thumbnail! 
# Saved the description
# Copied the text from the code block
# Pasted on a file
# Ran *xxd <filename>* from terminal
 !Screen Shot 2019-02-28 at 6.02.19 PM.png|thumbnail! 

(!) Characters *e2*, *80* and *8c* were added

h3. Workaround
We have found a web tool that can be used to remove *non-ascii characters* from scripts that may have been corrupted by this bug.
 * https://pteo.paranoiaworks.mobi/diacriticsremover/

h5. Note
The tool referenced above is *not officially supported by Atlassian*.
fields.summary: Invalid characters being added to code block

fields.description:
h3. Description
When defining values for select list fields, the dropdown is not scrolled if using *keyboard arrows*. 

h3. How to reproduce
# When creating an issue, click on a *dropdown* field (i.e. Components)
# Press the up/down arrows to browse through available options

h3. Expected result
If not all options are displayed, the list should automatically move up or down as you pressed the keyboard arrows, so that all options could be viewed

h3. Actual results
The list does not follow the selected item if not all objects are displayed
*   [^dropdown.mov] 

h3. Workaround
Scroll the list before choosing desired option
fields.summary: Dropdown lists are not scrolled if using keyboard arrows

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In *new [Jira notifications|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/blog/2019/02/jira-emails-are-changing]* the email does not contain the comment which is added to a screen while transitioning an issue. However, comment added by the customer through the portal, or a regular comment added to the issue without any transition is included in the Jira notification.  
Customer notification is working fine.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Make sure your instance has the new [Jira notifications|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/blog/2019/02/jira-emails-are-changing] enabled
* Edit the notification scheme to notify project role "Service Desk Team" whenever a comment is added to the issue
* Create an issue and assign it to one agent
* Make sure the transition between service desk agent and customer has a screen associated to add comments
* Make the above transition as an agent and add a comment to the screen
 
h3. Expected Results
The customer receives a notification along with the comments
All agents receive a notification along with the comments (As per notification scheme)

h3. Actual Results
The customer receives a notification along with the comments *YES*
All agents receive a notification along with the comments (As per notification scheme) *Notification is received without comment*
Agents receive a notification only about the transition made from one status to another. However, it does not contain the comment which was added to the screen as part of this transition:
 !Email without comment.png|thumbnail!   

h3.Notes
The issue happens only when Issue transition is the primary action and has a comment added to the screen associated with the transition.

h3.Workaround
As an agent add a comment separately and then transition the issue.
fields.summary: Jira notification does not contain the comment which is added to a screen while transitioning an issue

fields.description:
It is annoying, if you click accidental on "Update" on the Addon Page and Jira/Confluence Update the Addon without  any questioning. Especially, if the update is a Paid one. 

 

Yeah, you can go back to the old version, but this is lost time that can be prevented by adding a questioning like "Would you really update?" or something like that.

 

Thanks and regards

Alex
fields.summary: Jira/Confluence should ask before Update Addon
Posting to /rest/globalconfig/1/customfieldoptions/{fieldid} clears  that field for all tickets

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Attachments do not import if project keys do not respect the default project key pattern

h3. Environment

* Jira Server to Jira Cloud migration

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On Jira Server, have projects with a keys outside of the following default pattern: [A-Z][A-Z0-9]+  (Example, 111-000001)
# Export a Server backup
# Import backup in to Cloud
# Create ZIP archive of /data/attachments/ directory from Server instance
# Use 'Import Attachments' function to import the Jira attachments

h3. Expected Results

Attachments are imported successfully

h3. Actual Results

Attachments do not load, no errors shown in logs

h3. Workaround

The project keys will need to be updated to respect the default project key pattern as well as update the attachment directories with the new project and issue keys
fields.summary: Attachments do not import if project keys do not respect the default project key pattern

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Pasting multi-line content from a plain text file to a description field removes line breaks of the text.
h3. Environment
 * Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a multi-line text on a plain text file
 # Copy the text
 # Paste the text to the description of an issue and save it
 # Edit the description and copy the multi-line text from it
 # Paste the text that was copied from the description back to a text file

h3. Expected Results

When pasting on the comment the text should keep formatting and once copied from the description and pasted in the text file it should still keep the formatting.
h3. Actual Results

When pasting on the description the text will keep its formatting respecting the lines although the space between lines appeared to be smaller than the standard, when copying from the description and pasting into the text file there will be no line breaks, it will result in a single line text.
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Copy & paste multi line text from plain text file to description does not keep the line breakers

fields.description:
h3. Summary

While creating an issue, the option to link an issue is restricted to filters and recently viewed issues. 
In the Detail Issue View, searching return any result of issues.

h3. Expected Results

Both should work on the same way or at least let the user search for any user in the moment of creation too.

h3. Actual Results

They work differently and in the Create Issue Screen, it's not complete.
fields.summary: Link Issues in any Screen should work as in the Detail View

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The slack notification to a room on it is not triggered during a transition if the transition has the "Email issue (JMWE add-on)" on the last position of the post-functions list.

Steps to Reproduce

# Create a workflow and add to a project;
# Integrate that project to a Slack room with the notifications enabled (transitions);
# Add, to a transition, the post-function Email issue (JMWE add-on) of the JMWE app;
# Trigger that transition.

h3. Expected Results

A notification should be sent to the Slack room after the transition was made

h3. Actual Results

No notification is sent to Slack

h3. Notes 

It only happens if the post-function of JMWE is the last position of the post-functions list

h3.Workaround

Change the position of the post-function *Email issue (JMWE add-on)* to _not_ be the last one.
fields.summary: Slack notifications not triggered due to a JMWE post-function

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Historical project access exposes some project details. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

- Creare Project_A.
- Grant the Browse Project permission to UserX on Project_A.
- As UserX, access Project_A via a browser and navigate around.
- Revoke the *Browse Project* for Project_A from UserX.
- Try to access https://<site>.atlassian.net/secure/BrowseProjects.jspa.


h3. Expected Results

The project should not be listed in the summary for the User. 

 !Expected.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Actual Results

Project_A details is still shown to the user. 

 !History.png|thumbnail! 

When the user tries to go inside the project, a permission error is returned.
fields.summary: Historical access exposes some project details

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Customer using the notification panel (bell icon) gets a notification of being mentioned in a comment for an issue. When the user opens the issue it opens in the old issue view instead of the new issue view. In spite of having the new issue view activated. 

The link contains a parameter for focused comment id and tab panel
E.g.: https://<sitename>.atlassian.net/browse/PKEY-XXX?focusedCommentId=10013&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels%3Acomment-tabpanel#comment-10013 

On inspecting the new issue view from the browser the comments do not have any Id's. Hence, the above paraments in the URL do not work for the new issue view


h3. Suggested Solution
Ability to view the issue in the new isseu view using the notification panel (bell icon) gets a notification of being mentioned in a comment for an issue.

h3. Why this is important
Customers willing  to view the issue in the new isseu view using the notification panel (bell icon) gets a notification of being mentioned in a comment for an issue.
fields.summary: New issue view should appear when user gets a notification of being mentioned in a comment

fields.description:
JIRA Create Screen Configure fields UI will not render correctly if the screen has a high number of fields and/or tabs where you will not be able to scroll and choose the field.
Environment

Steps to Reproduce
# Create a screen with a high number of fields and tabs
# You might need to resize the windows, at it depends on the proportion
# Click on the Configure fields button to manage the fields you want the screen to show

Expected Results
* JIRA will show all fields available for the screen in Configure fields UI
Actual Results
* The window has a delimited size and doesn't display all the fields below:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

Notes

Workaround
# Zoom out the browser view to 67% 
# Refresh the page and click on *Configure Field* it will display all the fields as shown below:
#*  !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Unable to scroll in the Configure fields frame from the Edit screen

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently you can not select a text field type for use in the statistic type of the pie chart.   However fields of type such as labels, versions, and select fields are all able to be used here.


h3. Suggested Solution
It would be helpful if we could use a text field in the same way we use a select field for this statistic type.


h3. Why this is important
In many instances of Jira, data has already been created in a field type of text, but then this data cannot be used to show issue statistics data.  Converting this data into a select field is rather tedious to accomplish in Jira.  It would be helpful if the gadget could simply use those field types instead.
fields.summary: Allow custom fields of type "Text Field" to be used as the Statistic Type for the Issue Statistics gadget

fields.description:
{panel:title=(i) Implementation of New Features Policy| borderStyle=| borderColor=| titleBGColor=#e0efff| bgColor=}
At the moment, we can't set an ETA for this feature to be released, since there's a number of factors that determine how our product team prioritizes new features.
You can learn more by reading [Implementation of New Features Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/implementation-of-new-features-policy-201294576.html].
{panel}

h3. Problem Definition

When a user tries to add a new transition to an active workflow, the message below is displayed:

{code:none}
You cannot perform this operation on a draft workflow
{code}

The user cannot figure out what to do to add a transition with this message.

h3. Suggested Solution

Clarify the user have to

# copy the current workflow
# add a transition to the copied workflow
# replace the current workflow with the copied one in workflow scheme

Or, add a link to [Cannot Add Transitions or Delete Steps in Draft Workflows|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/cannot-add-transitions-or-delete-steps-in-draft-workflows-203392961.html].

h3. Note
Strictly saying, the message "You cannot perform this operation on a draft workflow" seems incorrect.
The reason why a user cannot add a transition is that the workflow is active but not because it is in a draft.

h3. Workaround

None. Consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of this feature request moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
fields.summary: Clarify workaround in UI when showing the message "You cannot perform this operation on a draft workflow"

fields.description:
As a Jira cloud administrator, I want the permission helper to mention when a user has not permission on products' features.

For example, a user who is only a Jira Core member cannot access Jira Software features. I want the permission helper to warn that a user cannot access Jira Software features since this user is only a Jira Core member.
fields.summary: As a Jira cloud administrator, I want the permission helper to mention when a user has not permission on products' features

fields.description:
h3. Description
When importing issues to a *classic project* using CSV files, Jira may add an invalid issue type to the issue type scheme if *next-gen projects* exist

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create a classic project
# Create a Next-Gen project
** *I.E.* the *Epic* issue type exists in both the Classic and Next-Gen projects. One of them, however, is only applicable for the *next-gen* project
# Create a simple CSV file that defines issues and their issue types, as exemplified below
{quote}
summary,issuetype
Teste Epic Bug,Epic
Teste Story,Story
{quote}
# Go to *Jira Settings > System > External System Import*
# Select CSV
# Upload the file, select a *Classic project* as the destination project and follow the prompts

h3. Expected result:
Issues are imported using the correct issue types

h3. Actual results:
A Next-Gen *Epic* issue type is added to the issue type scheme, causing the following message to be presented:
 !Screen Shot 2019-02-26 at 4.52.08 PM.png|thumbnail! 

This may cause issues to be imported using the wrong issue type.

h3. Workaround:
An existing workaround is to import the CSV file using the issue type's *IDs* instead of their "Names". This can be gathered by going to *Jira Settings > Issues > Issue Types* and click *Edit* next to the issue type. The ID will be displayed on the *URL*
 * Example : https://<instance>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/EditIssueType!default.jspa?id=<ID>

h3. (!) Fixing the problem:
If a CSV file *has already been imported* and the problem represented by the image below exists, please contact [Atlassian support|https://support.atlassian.com/contact]
*  !Screen Shot 2019-02-26 at 4.52.08 PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: External System Import to Classic Projects using CSV adds Next-Gen Issue Type to Scheme

fields.description:

Jira Cloud + New issue view

h3. Notes

h3. Workaround
Disable the new issue view on _Profile settings_

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

New email notification does not use the Email from settings in Jira

h3. Steps to Reproduce

- Go to *Jira Settings > System > General COnfiguration*
- Edit the *Email from* settings
- Set it to {{[MY_IDENTIFIER] ${fullname}}}
- Inspect the notifications from Jira. 

h3. Expected Results

The From header should indicate

{code}
From:	"[MY_IDENTIFIER] Name " <jira@site.atlassian.net>
{code}

h3. Actual Results

The From header indicates:

{code}
From:	Jira <jira@site.atlassian.net>
{code}
fields.summary: New email notification does not use the Email from settings

fields.description: The issue statistics gadget is heavily used by the customers to track the health and the throughput of the customer's operation. It would be very useful if it was added to this gadget the option to track the issue per date (day, week, month, year).
fields.summary: Statistics Gadget with date options
